title: Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were very friendly. There was one main interviewer and another person taking notes. The interview took around 45 minutes with questions about myself, teamworking and also about the role I applied for.
Interview Questions: How do you manage conflicts in a team?

title: Vice President FER Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is well-explained, easy to prepare if you call some predecessors. make sure to come up with some creative ideas and be able to come up with examples of teamwork, agility and that sort of thing.
Interview Questions: 3 strenghts 3 weaknesses also you get the opportunity to pitch your own ideas

title: Business Development Manager Incoming Global Talent Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers checked my understanding of AIESEC's vision and mission, as well as my motivations for becoming a member. They asked what skills I would like to develop through this experience.
Interview Questions: What skills would you like to develop as a member of AIESEC?

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: There was an assessment centre followed by a zoom interview; interview had general questions about passion for the organisation, specific role interests within the given department, character indicator questions, etc
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you failed at something and how you dealt with it.

title: IGT Vice President Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Good - It was quite challenging when you have to compete against other applicants but overall it was a great experience. The panel was nice and other teammates were helpful.
Interview Questions: What will you do as a iGT VP?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: The individual interview process is very efficient and the HR is extremely friendly. The group interview is also great, in which I actively participated in a group discussion to solve a practical question. I enjoyed it a lot and got the job eventually.
Interview Questions: Q: How to resolve the culture conflict between youths from different nations and cultures.

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Glasgow, Scotland) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: There was an application. After sending in the application I had to wait for several days before I got the interview. The interview was bunch of questions about your personality and why you want the role.
Interview Questions: Why are you good for this role ?

title: VPTM Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: there is an assessment centre where you would get some group activities with other potential members. After that, you will have an interview with the lcp from your local branch and from the national level.
Interview Questions: What is your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Application form - a set of questions, CV, and personality test.
Then presentation - open and close speach.
Questions from various people.
The interview happened in Microsoft Teams. The whole interview and presentation took a longer time then expected. It was from 4 pm till 18 pm.
Interview Questions:
What is your vision?
What do you want to achieve?
What are your strategies?

title: LCVP Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at AIESEC (Birmingham, England) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email for application and I was assigned for thirty minutes interview alone via zoom. There are around 5 or more questions asked by each interviewer. (3 interviewers in total)
Interview Questions: what is your strengths and weaknesses

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Glasgow, Scotland) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It was an online interview that had 3 parts. 
1) review cv of a random person and how you can improve it
2) problem solving; a situation like loosing an important document and how do you deal with it and do you do next
3) sales; they ask you do a sales pitch on one of their products
Interview Questions: Who is your biggest inspiration?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: It was a good experience. I first had an interview with my university then got an interview with the host university. It was very laid back and an easy process.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses and how do you deal with difficulties?

title: Vice President Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (London, England) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Before interviewing, I had to complete questions related to the organisation, the role I was applying for, and why I am suitable for the role + an online test + personality test + CV + presentation + assessment centre.
Interview Questions: What makes you stand out?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at AIESEC
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed was done over the phone. Was around 15 minutes. Interviewer explained scope of work and the team leader of sales position. Described his personal experience in the function (iGT).
Interview Questions: Can you pitch me the Global Volunteer Program?

title: President Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at AIESEC (London, England) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Assessment center then interview and with election days. It can be quite tough but fulfilling to go through the whole process. Most likely takes around 3 weeks to get through everything
Interview Questions: What is your purpose applying for this?

title: Global Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Signed up for the Clean Water and Sanitation project, filled out the application on the opportunity portal. The committee got back to me pretty fast (within a week) for an interview.
Interview Questions: Competency based questions: why did you choose to participate in this project; strengths and weaknesses; what kind of people do you look for in your team

title: Voulenteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Signed up online at a stall then called to interview after a week. Many students waiting outside then rotating interview one on one and assessment centre with sales task. Was relaxed atmosphere.
Interview Questions: What animal would you be?

title: Marketing and Communications Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at AIESEC (Birmingham, England) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Quite easy, was asked basic questions about my personality, what motivates and inspires me. There could some questions on creativity, imagination, achievements, future goals etc. The interviewer was a student like me, so i did not feel a big pressure on me during the interview.
Interview Questions: The greatest achievement you believe you have achieved in your life?

title: Outgoing Exchange Team Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at AIESEC (London, England) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: including an AC with many people around, played games, the interviews are straightforward. We did mash-mallow challenge which is a standard activity, followed by group discussion, with a short group presentation, (everyone need to say at least a line). The whole process was easy to get through. Just be confident and everything will be fine. I met the president in Leeds in the same year, had a little chat, and AIESEC encourages people when things go wrong, the let go things and let you try on you hand.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time that you worked in a team

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at AIESEC (Nottingham, England) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with AIESEC member to discuss position
Interview Questions: None
